required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective Observational Study in Adult and Pediatric Patients With HSCT-TMA
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Observational Study of Adult and Pediatric Patients With Thrombotic Microangiopathy (TMA) After Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplant (HSCT)

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational, retrospective study designed to assess outcomes in patients diagnosed with hematopoietic stem cell transplant-associated thrombotic microangiopathy (HSCT-TMA) who were not treated with complement component (C5) inhibitor therapy. Data required to evaluate study outcomes will be abstracted from the medical records of all patients who meet study eligibility criteria.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients achieving TMA Response
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the 26-week period after HSCT-TMA diagnosis
primary_outcome.description: TMA Response is defined as platelet count ≥ 50,000/mm^3, lactate dehydrogenase < 1.5 upper limit of normal, absence of schistocytes (if present at baseline), and increase in eGFR ≥ 30% from baseline or discontinuation of dialysis (for patients on dialysis at baseline)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients achieving TMA response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 52-week period after HSCT-TMA diagnosis

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in individual components of TMA response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 26 weeks and to 52 weeks after HSCT-TMA diagnosis
secondary_outcome.description: Platelets, lactate dehydrogenase, eGFR, chronic kidney disease stage, dialysis status

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 26 weeks and 52 weeks after HSCT-TMA diagnosis
At 26 weeks and 52 weeks after HSCT-TMA diagnosis
secondary_outcome.description: Death due to any cause during the study, with the exception of death due to underlying disease progression or relapse

intervention.description: No study intervention will be administered as part of this study.

study_pop.textblock: Adult and pediatric patients who were diagnosed with TMA within 6 months after a HSCT procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body weight ≥ 5 kg at the time of HSCT-TMA diagnosis
- Documented TMA diagnosis within 6 months from the HSCT
- Evidence of renal dysfunction
- Presence of hypertension
Exclusion Criteria:
- History or presence of familial or acquired 'a disintegrin and metalloproteinase with a thrombospondin type 1 motif, member 13' (ADAMTS13) deficiency (activity < 5%)
- Shiga toxin-related hemolytic uremic syndrome (ST-HUS)
- Positive direct Coombs test
- Diagnosis of disseminated intravascular coagulation
- History or presence of bone marrow/graft failure
- Diagnosis of veno-occlusive disease
- Received a complement inhibitor (eg, eculizumab) post-HSCT through 12 months post TMA diagnosis
